results.title: Identifying Fire Hazards
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safetycare”.
Identifying potential fire hazards is an extension of a basic good housekeeping policy - preventing fires by identifying and removing potential fire hazards should be regular practice in all workplaces. This video tells what to look for to make sure safety precautions such as fire doors are functioning properly and will serve their intended purpose in an emergency. Sprinklers, safe storage, controlling incoming goods, proper ventilation are some of the points.

results.title: Hand tools
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safetycare”.
This program demonstrates the correct usage of basic handtools and the safety procedures to remember when working with these tools. Discusses spanners, wrenches, pliers, hammers and hacksaws, showing the correct use and maintenance for maximum working condition.

results.title: Good Housekeeping
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safetycare”.
A strictly maintained and controlled good housekeeping policy is an essential part of any safety plan. It achieves a reduction in slips, trips, and falls type accidents, eliminates many potential fire hazards and makes for a generally more pleasant work environment.

results.title: Facts about Fire
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safetycare”.
To understand how fires start and to develop an understanding of preventative techniques a basic knowledge of the chemistry of fire is an important first step. This video examines in detail the fire triangle and leads into control measures by showing how the components of the triangle are kept separated in the workplace.

results.title: Electrical safety in the workplace
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safetycare”.
Looks at the effects and potential hazards associated with electricity, including definitions of basic terms, facts about how electricity is conducted and the effects of electrical currents on the human body. It identifies common hazards found in the workplace including overhead power lines, damp locations and the use of extension cords, as well as the importance of insulation and wearing appropriate personal protective equipment. Presented by Peter Mitchell.

results.title: Dealing with manual handling
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safetycare”.
As a safety issue manual handling is easily the most contentious. In every workplace manual handling occurs in some form or other - lifting, pushing, pulling, pouring, wearing weighty clothing, all fit the category of manual handling. This video examines the types of manual handling, the resulting types of problems and injuries and explains through a hierarchy of control measures how all manual handling situations should be addressed.

results.title: Building Evacuation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safetycare”.
Runners, floor wardens, chief warden, warning systems, communication systems, Master Emergency Communication Point, assembly areas, mobility impaired people, order of evacuation, when to evacuate…these are just some of the details that need to be considered in the evacuation of a building. Every person in a building needs to know their role in an evacuation. This video addresses the principles of evacuation of any building.

results.title: Bomb threat strategy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safetycare”
Preventative measures, what to look for, search procedures, assessing the threat, the telephone call, when to evacuate and the correct evacuation procedures are the key points covered in this video.
